title: "Quarto Basics"
---

## What is Quarto?

Quarto is a publishing system for technical docs. You write a `.qmd` file (Markdown + optional code), and Quarto renders it to **HTML**, **PDF**, slides, and more. By default it renders to **HTML** unless you specify another format.

---

## Install & verify

- Install Quarto: https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/  
- Verify in a terminal:
  ```bash
  quarto check
  quarto --version
````

* PDF requires a TeX engine (e.g., TinyTeX). To install:

  ```bash
  quarto install tinytex
  ```

---

## Your first document

Make `report.qmd`:

```markdown
---
title: "My Report"
format: html   # default is html if omitted
---

# Hello, Quarto

This is **Markdown**. Add text, lists, images, and code blocks.
```

Render to HTML:

```bash
quarto render report.qmd --to html
```

---

## PDF first (our default in course templates)

Set `format: pdf` in the YAML:

```markdown
---
title: "PDF-first example"
format: pdf
---
```

Or set options for multiple formats:

```markdown
---
title: "PDF-first with options"
format:
  pdf:
    toc: true
    number-sections: true
  html:
    toc: true
---
```

PDF needs LaTeX (TinyTeX is the easiest option).

---

## Render from RStudio or VS Code

* **RStudio**: open a `.qmd` and click **Render**.
* **VS Code**: install the Quarto extension; use **Quarto: Render** or run `quarto render` in the integrated terminal.

---

## Project basics (render only what you intend)

Quarto projects let you render a folder of documents with shared settings and control *which* files render:

```yaml
# site/_quarto.yml (this website)
project:
  type: website
  output-dir: _site
  render:
    - index.qmd
    - pages/**/*.qmd
```

That whitelist prevents Quarto from roaming the entire repository.

---

## Execution control: cache & freeze (optional)

* **Cache**: store chunk results so long computations aren’t re-run.
* **Freeze** (project-level): reuse previously rendered results during project renders:

  ```yaml
  execute:
    freeze: auto
  ```

---

## Common options

* **Table of contents**: `toc: true`
* **HTML niceties**: `code-fold`, `toc-expand`, etc.
* **PDF**: `geometry`, `documentclass`, `keep-tex`, `include-in-header` for LaTeX tweaks.

---

## Troubleshooting quick hits

* **“No TeX installation detected”** → run `quarto install tinytex` or re-run `mccourse_setup()`.
* **Renders the whole repo** → add `project.render` (see above).
* **Still stuck** → check the Quarto Troubleshooting page: [https://quarto.org/docs/troubleshooting/](https://quarto.org/docs/troubleshooting/)
